N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 15.11 - Indemnification

State Regulations
(a) The City of New

York shall indemnify and save harmless the Commisioner of Motor Vehicles from
and against any and all liability, damage, expense, casues of action, suits, claims, penalties or judgments arising from the administration and collection
of tax pursuant to this agreement. (b) The City of New York shall, at its own
cost and expense, defend any and all suits and actions which may be brought
against the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, or in which the Commissioner of

Motor Vehicles may be impleaded with others, arising from the administration
and collection of the tax. (c) In
the event of the failure of the City of New York to do so, the Commissioner of

Motor Vehicles may, at the cost and expense of the City of New York and upon
prior written notice to the commissioner of finance, defend any and all such
actions, and the City of New York shall satisfy, pay and discharge any and all
judgments that may be recovered against the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles. If
the City of New York fails to make any such payments, the Commissioner of Motor

Vehicles may pay the same, together with any related costs and interest, and
may deduct such payments from any revenues collected under this agreement that
would otherwise be distributed to the department of finance. Notes
